title: Drawing, "Costume Design of a Jewish Boy described as a Pharisee, a Fig Tree, and Heads, Palestine", February–April 1868
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at upper left:  book in a stone crock; at central left captioned: Jewish boy / Pharisee; and at center right: fur / pink / black; and at lower margin: grey; and beneath: Fig
description: Vertical view on top row showing at right a book in a stone crock at left and the head in central row left, shown from the rear left side; on central row at left a head with headgear, shown slightly obliquely and lowered, and at right the same boy seen from the back left standing; and across the bottom horizontally a tree without leaves is visible.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Costume Design of a Jewish Boy described as a Pharisee, a Fig Tree, and Heads, Palestine", February–April 1868.
February–April 1868. Graphite on light brown paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-185.
